titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank Wright National Corporation proposal for Bohemian beer advertising campaign, circa 1955-1957 RL.00415

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Frank Wright National Corporation proposal for Bohemian beer advertising campaign
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Advertising agency based in San Francisco and Los Angeles. One large portfolio featuring the corporation's campaign proposal, with 5 advertisements, to sell Bohemian beer in the California market. The proposal was presented to Carl Walters, of Southern Brewing Company in Los Angeles. There is no date on the proposal and no indication whether it was successful.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Frank Wright National Corporation proposal for Bohemian beer advertising campaign, circa 1955-1957, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Advertising agency based in San Francisco and Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: One large portfolio featuring the corporation's campaign proposal, with 5 advertisements, to sell Bohemian beer in the California market. The proposal was presented to Carl Walters, of Southern Brewing Company in Los Angeles. There is no date on the proposal and no indication whether it was successful.
